CalSciPy.trace_processing module

CalSciPy.trace_processing.calculate_dfof(traces, frame_rate=30, in_place=False, offset=0.0, raw=None)[source]

Calculates Δf/f0 (fold fluorescence over baseline). Baseline is defined as the 5th percentile of the signal after a 1Hz low-pass filter using a Hamming window.

Parameters

  • traces (numpy.ndarray) -- matrix of traces in the form of neurons x frames

  • frame_rate (float = 30) -- frame rate of dataset

  • in_place (bool = False) -- boolean indicating whether to perform calculation in-place

  • offset (float) -- offset added to baseline; useful if traces are non-negative

  • raw (numpy.ndarray or None) -- raw dataset used to calculate baseline; useful if traces have been factorized

Returns

Δf/f0 matrix of n neurons x m samples

Return type

numpy.ndarray

CalSciPy.trace_processing.calculate_standardized_noise(fold_fluorescence_over_baseline, frame_rate=30)[source]
Calculates a frame-rate independent standardized noise as defined as:
\(v = \frac{\sigma \frac{\Delta F}F}\sqrt{f}\)

It is robust against outliers and approximates the standard deviation of Δf/f0 baseline fluctuations. For comparison, the more exquisite of the Allen Brain Institute's public datasets are approximately 1*%Hz^(-1/2)

Parameters

  • fold_fluorescence_over_baseline (numpy.ndarray) -- fold fluorescence over baseline (i.e., Δf/f0)

  • frame_rate (float = 30) -- frame rate of dataset

Returns

standardized noise (units are 1*%Hz^(-1/2) )

Return type

numpy.ndarray

CalSciPy.trace_processing.detrend_polynomial(traces, in_place=False)[source]

Detrend traces using a fourth-order polynomial

Parameters

  • traces (numpy.ndarray) -- matrix of traces in the form of neurons x frames

  • in_place (bool = False) -- boolean indicating whether to perform calculation in-place

Returns

detrended traces

Return type

numpy.ndarray

CalSciPy.trace_processing.smooth_perona_malik(traces, iters=5, kappa=100, gamma=0.15)[source]

Edge-preserving smoothing using perona malik diffusion

Parameters

  • traces (numpy.ndarray) -- a matrix of neurons x frames

  • iters (int = 5) -- number of iterations

  • kappa (int = 100) -- diffusivity conductance

  • gamma (float = 0.15) -- step size (must be less than 1)

Returns

smoothed traces

Return type

numpy.ndarray
